title: Jump Game III
description: You are given an array of integers, nums, where nums[i] represents the maximum jump length at position i. Your goal is to determine if you can reach the last index starting from the first index. You can jump forward only if you can reach the index with a non-negative jump length. If you can reach the last index, return true. Otherwise, return false.
output_format: A boolean value indicating whether you can reach the last index.

examples.explanation: You can jump to index 1 (3), then jump to index 4 (4), which is the last index.
You will always get stuck at index 3, unable to reach the last index.

hints: Keep track of the farthest index you can reach.
